data.title: Weather in Leipzig in October
data.meta_description: Discover the average weather, temperature and general climate of Leipzig in october. Find cheap flights in october and plan your trip to Leipzig on Avionero
data.text:
The expected average maximum temperature in October is +63°F with a maximum of +81°F and a minimum of +34°F.

The average maximum temperature goes down 38% by the end of the month, compared with the beginning of the month, from +73°F to +55°F.

Leipzig is typically mild in October.

Maximum temperatures go down compared to the previous month from +66°F to +57°F. The minimum temperature also goes down from +52°F to +45°F.

Pack a light jacket as it will be warm in the day and cool in the evenings.

Take a look at how October is compared to other months in Leipzig:

October weather is still as ok as in September. It’s getting colder in October. From +66°F in the day, the average maximum temperature lowers to +57°F. As October arrives, the amount of rainfall goes down. On average, the rainfall volume decreases from 55 mm to 50 mm. Humidity rises from 75% to 80%. Winds are stronger in comparison to September, going up from 2 m/s to 3 m/s on average. The days becoming less sunny, going from 7 sunny days in September to 6 in October.

November brings much the same weather, it remains ok.

The average wind speed is 5 m/s getting up to 9 m/s which is a medium breeze. You can feel it, especially getting out of the water.

The average wind speed in Leipzig is gradually increasing during October, going from 4 m/s to 7 m/s over the course of the month.

The climate in Leipzig in October has not changed that much over the last 43 years.

The average temperature was the lowest in 1996 (+52°F) and the highest in 2019 (+61°F). The driest year was 2018 with only 357 mm of rainfall, and the wettest year was 2021 with 1744 mm.

For this page, we’ve looked at the typical weather in Leipzig, based on historical hourly weather data from January 1, 1979, to December 31, 2022.

For past dates, we show actual recorded data at the location at that time. Forecasts are based on recorded weather during that day of the year, averaged over the total years for which we have records (unless stated otherwise). The daily temperature is the highest recorded temperature in the shadow during that day.
